note: Explicit torsion-prediction regimes for torsion_bounds_mapping. This is a TFPT-side input: it declares which physical regime is being tested (vacuum today vs a nontrivial source model). The goal is to avoid an 'always green' bounds module by making the regime choice explicit and falsifiable.

regimes.label: Vacuum today (Einstein–Cartan minimal: torsion sourced by spin ⇒ vanishes in vacuum)
regimes.note: This is the minimal local-lab/vacuum theorem regime. It is not a falsification regime because S_mu=0 always satisfies bounds.

regimes.label: Cosmological background (order H0)
regimes.note: Toy regime: set |S_mu| ≈ c_factor · H0 (in GeV). This is nonzero but typically far below SME bounds.

regimes.label: Spin-polarized lab benchmark (ferromagnet-like; TFPT scale coupling)

coupling_scale.note: Use TFPT R^2 scale M as the effective torsion coupling scale (explicit assumption).

regimes.note: Illustrative lab-scale benchmark. For realistic lab densities this typically predicts extremely small |S_mu|, but it is explicitly nonzero.

regimes.label: Spin-density benchmark (nuclear density; TFPT scale coupling)

coupling_scale.note: Use TFPT R^2 scale M as the effective torsion coupling scale (explicit assumption).

regimes.note: Illustrative high-density benchmark (order nuclear matter). This is not an Earth-lab environment, but it demonstrates a genuinely nontrivial torsion regime with a potentially testable magnitude under the explicit TFPT-scale coupling assumption.
